meanings.definition: To enjoy or appreciate something with great delight or pleasure.
meanings.sent1: I savor the delicious chocolate cake slowly to truly enjoy its taste.
meanings.sent2: She always takes her time to savor the beauty of a sunset.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to savor the warmth of the sunbeam on the window sill.
meanings.sent4: As she closed her eyes, she could savor the sweet memories of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The old man would savor each sip of his morning coffee, savoring the aroma and flavor.

meanings.definition: A distinctive taste or smell, especially a pleasant one.
meanings.sent1: The chef added a special ingredient to give the dish a unique savor.
meanings.sent2: The savor of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen with a delightful aroma.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected savor of cinnamon in the soup made everyone curious.
meanings.sent4: The savor of victory was sweet as they celebrated their win.
meanings.sent5: The savor of the ocean breeze brought back memories of summer vacations by the shore.
